title: Equality
description:
Equality Read problems statements in Mandarin Chinese and Russian as well.

An equation is an equality containing one or more variables. Solving the equation consists of determining which values of the variables make the equality true. In this situation, variables are also known as unknowns and the values which satisfy the equality are known as solutions. An equation differs from an identity in that an equation is not necessarily true for all possible values of the variable.
There are many types of equations, and they are found in all areas of mathematics. For instance, a linear equation is an algebraic equation in which each term is either a constant or the product of a constant and (the first power of) a single variable.
In this problem we'll consider quite a special kind of systems of linear equations. To be more specific, you are given a system of N linear equations of the following form:

	x2 + x3 + ... + xN - 1 + xN = a1
	x1 + x3 + ... + xN - 1 + xN = a2
	...
	x1 + x2 + ... + xN

title: Anti Palindrome
description:
Anti PalindromeDefinitions:
A string TTT is called semi-palindrome if you can rearrange the characters of TTT to make it into a palindrome.
For eg. if T=aabbT = aabbT=aabb, it isn't a palindrome as of now, but it can be rearranged to form abbaabbaabba, which is a palindrome. Thus, T=aabbT = aabbT=aabb is a semi-palindrome.
An anti-palindrome is the opposite of a semi-palindrome. In particular, a string TTT is called an anti-palindrome if it is not possible to rearrange the characters of TTT to make it into a palindrome.
For eg. if T=abcT = abcT=abc, there is no rearrangement of this string which makes it into a palindrome. Hence, T=abcT = abcT=abc is an anti-palindrome.

Now on to the problem:

(c) A Wiki of Ice and Fire

title: Joker and Batman
description:
Joker and BatmanRead problem statements in Russian, Mandarin Chinese, Bengali, and Vietnamese as well.
During a fight with the Joker, Batman's eyes lose the capability to distinguish between some pairs of colors.
Each color has an integer ID from 111 to NNN. There are MMM lists where each color belongs to exactly one list. Batman can distinguish colors belonging to different lists, but he cannot distinguish colors belonging to the same list.
Given a strip of LLL colors, find the different number of segments Batman will see as a result of his disability. Two positions of the strip are said to belong to the same segment if they are adjacent on the strip and Batman cannot distinguish their colors. See the sample explanation for clarity.

Input Format

The first line contains an integer TTT, the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow.
The first line contain three integers NNN, MMM, and LLL - the number of colors, the number of lists, and the length of the strip, respectively.

2 8 3 1 6 4 5 7

However, the canteen is about to run out of some ingredients. In particular, they only have EEE eggs and HHH chocolate bars left. They need:
